Sequence Information.Function: Sapecins, which are potent bactericidal proteins, are produced in response to injury. Sapecin is cytotoxic to Gram-positive bacteria, and to a lesser extent against Gram-negative bacteria.

Literature.Title: Molecular cloning of cDNA for sapecin and unique expression of the sapecin gene during the development of Sarcophaga peregrina.
Literature.Author: Natori S.,Matsuyama K.

Literature.Title: Purification of three antibacterial proteins from the culture medium of NIH-Sape-4, an embryonic cell line of Sarcophaga peregrina.
Literature.Author: Natori S.,Matsuyama K.

Literature.Title: Determination of the disulfide array in sapecin, an antibacterial peptide of Sarcophaga peregrina (flesh fly).
Literature.Author: Natori S.,Matsuyama K.,Nakajima Y.,Kuzuhara T.

Literature.Title: 1H nuclear magnetic resonance study of the solution conformation of an antibacterial protein, sapecin.
Literature.Author: Kohda D.,Komano H.,Kuzuhara T.,Shimada I.,Hanzawa H.
